clean_content:
Definition / general

* WHO classification of tumors of the pancreas* Currently on [5th edition](https://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/9283244990/pathologyoutl-20), published in 2019* Based on histologic appearance, not molecular characteristics

WHO (2019)

**Benign epithelial tumors and precursors** **ICD-O codes*** [Serous cystadenoma, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasserous.html) 8441/0
  + Macrocystic (oligocystic) serous cystadenoma+ Solid serous adenoma+ Von Hippel-Lindau syndrome associated serous cystic neoplasm+ Mixed serous-neuroendocrine neoplasm* Serous cystadenocarcinoma, NOS 8441/3* [Glandular intraepithelial neoplasia, low grade](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspanin.html) 8148/0* [Glandular intraepithelial neoplasia, high grade](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspanin.html) 8148/2* [Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm with low grade intraepithelial neoplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasipmn.html) 8453/0* [Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm with high grade intraepithelial neoplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasipmn.html) 8453/2* [Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasipmn.html) 8453/3* [Intraductal oncocytic papillary neoplasm, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasiopn.html) 8455/2* [Intraductal oncocytic papillary neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasiopn.html) 8455/3* [Intraductal tubulopapillary neoplasm](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasitpn.html) 8503/2* [Intraductal tubulopapillary neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasitpn.html) 8503/3* [Mucinous cystic neoplasm with low grade intraepithelial neoplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmcn.html) 8470/0* [Mucinous cystic neoplasm with high grade intraepithelial neoplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmcn.html) 8470/2* [Mucinous cystic neoplasm with associated invasive carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmcn.html) 8470/3

  

**Malignant epithelial tumors** **ICD-O codes*** [Duct adenocarcinoma, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasductal.html) 8500/3
  + [Colloid carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreascolloid.html) 8480/3+ Poorly cohesive carcinoma 8490/3+ **Signet ring cell carcinoma** 8490/3+ [Medullary carcinoma, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmedullary.html) 8510/3+ [Adenosquamous carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasadenosquamous.html) 8560/3+ Epidermoid carcinoma 8576/3+ Large cell carcinoma with rhabdoid phenotype 8014/3+ [Carcinoma, undifferentiated, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasundifferentiated.html) 8020/3+ [Undifferentiated carcinoma with osteoclast-like giant cells](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasosteoclastic.html) 8035/3* [Acinar cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasacinar.html) 8550/3
    + **Acinar cell cystadenocarcinoma** 8551/3+ [Mixed acinar-neuroendocrine carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmixed.html#mixedacinarendocrinetumor68290) 8154/3+ [Mixed acinar-endocrine-ductal carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmixed.html#mixedacinarductalendocrinetumor68292) 8154/3+ [Mixed acinar-ductal carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmixed.html#mixedacinarductal68289) 8552/3* [Pancreatoblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspancreatoblastoma.html) 8971/3* [Solid pseudopapillary neoplasm of the pancreas](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreassolidpseudo.html) 8452/3
        + Solid pseudopapillary neoplasm with high grade dysplasia

  

[Pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasms](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspen.html) **ICD-O codes*** Pancreatic neuroendocrine microadenoma 8150/0* [Neuroendocrine tumor, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasWDNET.html) 8240/3
    + Neuroendocrine tumor, grade 1 8240/3+ Neuroendocrine tumor, grade 2 8249/3+ Neuroendocrine tumor, grade 3 8249/3* [Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, nonfunctioning](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasWDNET.html) 8150/3
      + Oncocytic pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, nonfunctioning+ Pleomorphic pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, nonfunctioning+ [Clear cell pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, nonfunctioning](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasclearcellendocrine.html)+ [Cystic pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, nonfunctioning](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreascysticendocrine.html)* [Functioning pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasWDNET.html)
        + [Insulinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasinsulinoma.html) 8151/3+ [Gastrinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasgastrinoma.html) 8153/3+ [VIPoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasvipoma.html) 8155/3+ [Glucagonoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasglucagonoma.html) 8152/3+ [Somatostatinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreassomatostatin.html) 8156/3+ [ACTH producing tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasacth.html) 8158/3+ Enterochromaffin cell carcinoid 8241/3+ Serotonin producing tumor 8241/3+ [Neuroendocrine carcinoma, NOS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasneuroendocrinecarcinoma.html) 8246/3
                          - Large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma 8013/3- Small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma 8041/3+ Mixed neuroendocrine - nonneuroendocrine neoplasm (MiNEN) 8154/3
                            - [Mixed acinar-endocrine carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmixed.html#mixedacinarendocrinetumor68290) 8154/3- [Mixed acinar-neuroendocrine carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmixed.html#mixedacinarendocrinetumor68290) 8154/3- [Mixed acinar-endocrine-ductal carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmixed.html#mixedacinarductalendocrinetumor68292) 8154/3
